loans.name: Karoline Jane

texts.es:
Karoline vive con su madre en Lima, capital del Perú. Ella proviene de un hogar de padres separados y su madre a sido padre y madre para ella, trabajando duro como enfermera de manera independiente para sacarla adelante en sus estudios.
Karoline estudia mecánica automotriz, una carrera mayormente demandada por hombres, sin embargo ella no se amilana y por el contrario, lo toma como un reto para dar su máximo esfuerzo y demostrar que puede triunfar y destacarse en una profesión normalmente masculina. Aunque su carrera demande usar uniforme y ensuciarse las manos, ella es una chica muy alegre y femenina y gusta mucho de verse bien.
Ella esta actualmente en el 5to ciclo y esta a un paso de culminar su carrera, ya que son 6 ciclos los que dura su carrera, sin embargo la falta de trabajo que atraviesa su madre dificulta que se generen ingresos suficientes para poder cubrir sus gastos de estudios. Esta situación originaria que deba abandonarlos faltando tan poco para concluirlos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva para lograrlo.
Karoline es una joven luchadora como su madre y quiere hacerla sentir orgullosa de ella, culminar su carrera y salir adelante juntas, es por estoque agradece mucho el apoyo que los beneficiarios de Kiva dan a jóvenes que como ella tienen muchas ganas de estudiar y triunfar en la vida dando su máximo esfuerzo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Karoline lives with her mother in Lima, the capital of Peru.  She comes from a household of parents that are separated.  Her mother has been father and mother to her.  Her mother has been working hard as an independent nurse in order to get her ahead in her education.

Karoline is studying automobile mechanics, a career that is mainly dominated by men.  Nevertheless, she is not intimidated.  To the contrary, she took it as a challenge to give her maximum effort and to show that she is able to triumph and stand out in a normally masculine profession.  Even though her career demands that she wear a uniform and get her hands dirty, she is a very happy and feminine girl.  She really likes to look good.

She is currently in the fifth cycle, and she is a step away from completing her degree.  There are six cycles in her career studies.  However, the lack of work that her mother is experiencing makes it difficult to generate enough income to be able to cover her educational expenses.  This situation means that she would need to leave her studies, with so little left to complete, if she does not have the support of the Kiva lenders.

Karoline is a tenacious young woman like her mother.  She wants to make her mother proud of her, complete her career studies, and get ahead together.  That is why she is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders give to young people like her who have a great desire to study and triumph in life, giving their maximum effort in order to do so.

loans.use: to be able to graduate from her auto mechanic career studies.

loans.name: Erika Verónica

texts.es:
Erika es una señora de 30 años de edad, es empleada, estudió hasta el tercer año de bachillerato en salud, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando; por lo tanto son los que dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja como motorista en un camión de venta de materiales para construcción.

Erika se dedica a trabajar como promotora social en la comunidad donde ella reside desde hace un año, trabajo que lo aprendió practicando en la escuela, para trasladarse a su trabajo Erika viaja en bicicleta cinco cuadras trabajando en el horario de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar materiales como cemento, ladrillo, hierro etc. Para la construcción de un corredor de su vivienda.

El sueño de Erika es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales, para que puedan alcanzar sus metas y ser unos jóvenes de bien.
texts.en:
Erika is 30 years old and is employed. She studied up to her junior year in high school in health. She is married and the mother of who three children who all study. 

They all depend on her. Her husband works as a truck driver for construction materials. 

Erika has been working as a social worker in the community she moved to a year ago. This is work she learned in school. 

To get to work Erika rides her bike 5 blocks working from 8am to 3pm. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy materials such as cement, brink, iron etc to build a hallway in her home. 

Her dream is that her children become professionals so that they can reach their goals and be well off.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, brink, iron etc to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to tend to his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Catachilla Alta Group

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, madre de dos hijas y se dedica  a la venta de comida.
Ella (segunda de la derecha, con delantal celeste abrazando a sus hijas) conformó una banca de personas con necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo y obtener una oportunidad para cambiar sus vidas.
Lourdes es amigable, luchadora, emprendedora, conversadora, siempre ofrece su ayuda a quién lo necesite y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de sacaba distante a 18 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
Lourdes es de tez morena, cabello largo trenzado, estatura mediana y viste de forma tradicional (manta y pollera), ella prepara y vende comida todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta, los días son; Lunes – escabeche (plato frío: cuero de chancho y vinagre), Martes – Charque (carne; llama o de res, que ha pasado por un proceso de deshidratación expuesta al sol por varios días cubierta de sal. Se trata de un plato ancestral) Miércoles - Ají de Fideo (fideo, papa, carne de res o carne de pollo, verduras como arvejas, habas y perejil picado), Jueves - Lapping (pecho de vaca asado al sartén acompañado con habas, choclo y papa cocida con cáscara, abundante ensalada y ají molido) Viernes - Lomo Borracho (contiene cebolla, tomate, zanahoria retostado en sartén y cocida con chicha o vino, con pedazos de carne de res incluye papas doradas, un filete de res asado y un huevo frito encima) Sábado - Ají de Patas (lleva arroz, papas blancas y carne que son parte de las patas de la res, arvejas que son cocidas con ají colorado molido) Domingo - Chicharrón (carne de cerdo acompañado de mote, chuño, y un rico y picante).
Su negocio tiene la necesidad de ollas y vajilla, ella sueña tener un restaurante grande y muy conocido por su buena cocina para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y de sus hijas a las que tanto ama.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de ollas y vajilla y así mejorar la forma de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters. She cooks and sells meals. (Lourdes is second from the right wearing blue and holding her daughters). The group is a communal bank composed of persons with similar necessities to request a loan and obtain an opportunity to change their lives.

Lourdes is friendly, combative, enterprising, and always ready to converse. She offers help to any who need it and she's very hard working. Her business is located in a zone 18 kilometers outside of the city of Cochabamba. Lourdes has a dark complexion, long braided hair, medium stature, and traditional appearance (with her apron and skirt). 

She prepares and sells meals every day of the week from her stall. On Mondays it's Escabeche (pig's skin with vinegar); Tuesday it's Charque (dehydrated llama meat or beef, salted and sun-dried for days). This is an ancestral dish. Wednesdays it's Aji de Fideo (beans, potatoes and beef, or chicken, with vegetables - green peas and parsley); Thursday it's Lapping (cow's breast fried with beans, and unpeeled potatoes, with lots of salad and chopped garlic; Fridays it's Lomo Borracho (with onions, tomato, carrots refried in a pan and cooked with chicha or wine, with pieces of beef and fried potatoes, or a grilled beef fillet with a fried egg on top), Saturday it's Aji de Patas (with rice, white potatoes and meat from the hooves of cattle, green peas cooked with chopped colored garlic; Sunday it's Chicharron (pig meat with boiled wheat, potato starch and spicy seasoning). 

Lourdes' business needs new pots and dishes. She dreams of having a grand restaurant, well known for its good cooking, in order to improve the quality of life of her family and her daughters who she loves so much. This is why Lourdes is motivated to request a loan to purchase pots and dishes and, thus, to improve her family's style of life.

loans.use: to buy pots and dishes and thereby improve the life style of their families.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped him to renovate his toilet and dramatically improve his living conditions. He is still employed with the electrical company and very satisfied with his work. 

Because Bajram was very happy with the last loan process, he is asking once again for a loan, but for the side electrical business he does. The loan will be used to purchase material for his business in order to meet the client needs and complete his work. 

Bajram is confident in his work, having been involved in this business for more than 14 years, and is confident the loan will help him to generate more income and improve his life more. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase material for his business.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.

Es un padre amoroso y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.

El siempre fue muy inquieto y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.

Hoy en día es un hombre amable y muy emprendedor, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

El solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Oscar has been able to gather big and pleasant experiences in his life, one of them is to have been able to work in a variety of grocery stores in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. He is a loving, responsible father, and he is very aware of the meaning of family in his working practices.

He has always been very dynamic and service oriented.  These qualities motivated him to start his own grocery store and make it very well known in the area. Nowadays he is a kind man, and very enterprising, always looking for options to make his clients feel they are getting good service and they are buying quality products. 

He requests a loan to buy a variety of basic family shopping products. He plans to expand his product offering and wants to keep a much larger inventory, thus being able to have the products available to his customers. 

His biggest dream is to be able to have a big provision distribution business, and he thinks he can progressively achieve it.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic family shopping products, such as grains and groceries, to stock his business.

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan is a baker. He is 38 years old and the father of five children. Luan has been in this business for more than ten years now. He is very well known in his area and has a lot of customers. 

During his entire career, Luan has been using the same tools, and they are very worn and old. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new mixer for the dough and some new tools. This is the first time that he is requesting a loan and is very happy for the opportunity. 

He hopes in the future to expand his business more and be able to hire an employee. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he appreciates the support and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase a new mixer for the dough and some new tools.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is a native of Plaridel. She is 40 years old. Milva has a sari-sari store business that she is hoping will eventually grow and develop so that she can save more for the education of her children.

She is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She said that if she has enough inventory, she will not miss opportunities and she can easily pay her loan. She is so thankful to Paglaum because of the trust they have given her.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 44 years old and lives in a village about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children - one son and four daughters. Two of her children are garment factory workers and the others attend school.   
 
Sokhom and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband is also a construction worker when he is not at the farm. 

Sokhom wants to buy a motorcycle for her daughters to drive to work. Because her daughters commute to work by bicycling, taking a bicycle is tiring, and they are not on time. Hence, Sokhom decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Siguidouma Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Siguidouma est constitué de neuf (9) femmes  toutes mariées et vie majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 47 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de, tubercules (pommes de terre), ustensiles plastiques, charbon du bois , savons et produits de beauté.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (Assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des tubercules (pommes de terre) à Kalaban-coura . Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Kalaban-coura au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Siguidoma group is composed of nine women who are married and living mainly in monogamous households. On the average, they are 47 years of age, with five children. They all live in Kalaban-coura, a neighborhood of Bamako. They know each other through local “tontines” (neighborhood savings group) and through their work. The group members works as vendors selling tubers (potatoes), plastic utensils, charcoal, soap and beauty products. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso [microfinance institution] and are on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the one seated on far right in the photo) is well-known as a potato vendor in Kalabn-coura. She plans to use her loan to buy four bags of potatoes. [She] stocks up in Médine. She sells in Kalaban-coura, for cash, to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some minor expenses for her children and  reinvest in her business. Mrs. Fatoumata is really counting on this partnership with Soro Yirwaso to achieve her goal—the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy tubers (potatoes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and fatten three pigs

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is a married father of 2 children, living in the southern part of Kosovo. He and his wife operate a tailoring business together and work from home. They have acquired many male and female clients over the many years they have been in business, since the beginning of their marriage.

Currently they are in need of a loan to purchase materials for their business in order to best meet the needs and satisfy the demands of their customers. Hafiz hopes that this loan will help them to gain more income for their family and help him to reach his goal of expanding his business and eventually hiring employees. He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his tailoring business in order to best meet the needs and satisfy the demands of his customers

loans.name: Haza

texts.en:
Haza wants to thank all of the lenders for helping her to be able to renovate her house. She has managed to have a healthy and normal life for her family. Her husband is still working as a bike mechanic, and she is doing some handicrafts in order to supplement their income. 

Now Haza needs a second loan for handicraft materials so that she can make and sell her items in the market. She hopes in the future to be able to expand her business and hopes that it will have a lot of profit. She wants to thank all of the lenders for this loan and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy handicraft materials to make and sell her items in the market.

loans.name: Zymrije

texts.en:
Zymrije wants to thank all of the lenders for the first loan that she used to purchase a cow. Although she is still working as a cleaner, she has been able to sell milk and the diary products that she has obtained from her new cow. Her husband is also involved in agriculture as he sees the potential profit and income and together they are supplementing their low incomes. They have been planting wheat on their land to sell at the market, but their machine is old and in need of repairs. 

Zymrije is now asking for a loan to repair the machine so they can be more effective and efficient with their plowing and harvesting. This loan will help them to be able to continue to earn additional income in an area that they consider profitable. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support and is very happy for this second loan.

loans.use: To repair the plowing/harvesting machine

loans.name: Bozidarka

texts.en:
Bozidarka is a mother of one grown daughter. Her husband is a taxi driver and she has a unique and interesting profession where she produces popular medications. She has been doing this business from her home for 17 years now, and she is very popular in her area as the only one who does this work. Basically, she prepares different medicines for different diseases. 

Now, Bozidarka is in need of a loan in order to purchase the raw materials for preparing the medicines. This loan would assist her in expanding her business and attaining growth as she will be able to supply more items for her customers and sell a larger range of products. In the near future, she is hoping to have her own shop and save money for her future. She is very grateful to Kiva for their support to help her grow and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase the raw materials for preparing popular medicine

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona is married, a mother of two children, and a housewife taking care of her children and her home all day while her husband works in construction. Her husband works very long hours, does very hard work, but earns only a small salary. 

Valbona is now requesting a loan in order to renovate her house, which has very unhealthy living conditions. This loan will help her to improve these conditions. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stolons (strawberry offshoots) and farming supplies.

loans.name: Dragan

texts.en: Dragan is 54 years old and a married father of 2 children, living in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. In order to earn a living he is working in a municipality with low salary, and is the main source of income for his family since his wife stays home to care for the children and the home. As most people in the minority communities, they live in poor conditions and they have never been able to do any renovations to their home. Now, for the first time, Dragan is requesting a loan in order to renovate his home. He hopes in the future to be able to improve the living conditions for his family. He wants to thank all of the lenders for this support.

loans.use: To renovate his home

loans.name: Lindana

texts.es:
Lindana de 30 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta segundo grado, no continuo sus estudios por problemas económicos en que vivían sus padres, esta soltera pero es madre de 3 hijas que se encuentran estudiando. vive con sus tres hijas las cuales dependen de ella, pero también vive con una sobrina y su mamá.

Lindana se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre, también trabaja en los cañales del ingenio, para llegar a su trabajo Lindana viaja en bicicleta a un kilometro, en el horario de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO es para comprar una vaca, donde espera obtener un ingreso mas y así podrá darle a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.

Lindana sueña con que sus hijas estudien mucho, para que sean unas personas de bien en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lindana is thirty years old and a homemaker. She has a second grade education and didn't stay in school because of her parents' financial problems. She is single but has three daughters who are all in school. She lives with her three daughters who depend on her, but she also lives with a niece and her mother.

Lindana has been raising animals for years, having learned from her father. She also works on the sugarcane plantations for the sugar refinery. To get to work, Lindana travels one kilometer on her bicycle. Her schedule is from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

She will use the loan she is requesting from CrediCampo to buy a cow, which will earn her some additional income in order to give her daughters a better quality of life.

Lindana wants her daughters to study hard so that they can become upstanding people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man, aged 38 years, with four children; three are attending different schools in different areas. He lives in a rural setting with his family: his mother, who is very old, and two of his nephews whose school fees he pays. He is a farmer who deals in growing maize and coffee on a large scale and started his business in 1995.

He works six days in a week and nine hours per day. He started his business to get food for his family and to earn a living. He has acquired this loan to buy more coffee to boost his agricultural business. His clients are traders from the city and those from nearby villages.

His future hope is to be the leading supplier of coffee and maize in the community especially for schools, and his challenge is weather changes, like too much drought. He is a hardworking man who thanks lenders on the good job they are doing for the rural communities.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 42 years old, lives with her husband and children in a village about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children - one son and four daughters. Two of her children are married and live separately, one is a security guard, one has full-time employment and another one attends school. Her husband is a driver for a company.

Srey buys fruit under contract from villagers from blooming season till the harvesting season comes. She needs to use pesticide to prevent insects from destroying her mangoes. She hopes to expand her business by buying additional fruits for resale. Hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to help her capital.

loans.use: To buy fruit under contract for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38 years old, married to Jane and blessed with five children aged between 15 and 4 years old. He has been running a sewing repair shop for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his second loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy spare parts for sewing machines.                                                                                            

Patrick will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family’s basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and open another business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat for his restaurant

loans.name: Selvete

texts.en: Selvete is 37 years old, married and a mother of 2 boys and 1 girl. She lives in a small village, and like many who live in her neighborhood she is involved in agriculture to increase their income. Her husband is employed in the fire brigade, but with low salary. She has one cow that she uses for her family needs, cutting expenses and adding food to their table. However, she is now planning to start a business by selling the milk and the dairy products in her village. In order to do so, she will need a loan to purchase another milk cow. This loan will help her to generate more income for the family and to improve their living conditions. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase another milk cow

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron is a father of two children and he comes from a minority community in Kosovo. He is a hairdresser for men and women and is very popular in his area. He has a lot of customers that he has gained through the ten years he has been in business. His wife has been helping him, so that he does not need to pay an employee and he can save additional money. 

Now, Agron is in need of a loan to purchase new inventory, such as chairs and various hair-styling tools. The loan will help him to improve his business and the increase in income he will gain will help him to improve the living conditions of his family. 

In the future, Agron hopes to be able to expand his business and be able to hire an employee. He is very grateful for this opportunity and he wants to thank all.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory, such as chairs and various hair-styling tools.

loans.name: Sladjana

texts.en: Sladana is from one of the minority communities and is 43 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, ages 9 and 17 years old. She and her husband are both employed by an electrical company. The house that they are living in is old and has been needing renovations for a long time. She would like to repair the roof of the house because any wet weather conditions such as snow and rain cause leaking in the house and damage the roof, the walls and the entire structure. She is requesting a loan in order to make the repairs that she has not been able to save money for in the past. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica por medio de la observación y, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller.

Adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas, trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero realizara la Compra de insumos para confeccion como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller.

Luz manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working and vigorous woman.  She always looks for ways to get ahead in life.For many years Luz has earned a living as a seamstress.  She learned this work by watching others and, little by little, improving her technique and increasing her knowledge in practice.  This led her to start her own workshop.

She eqipped an area in the house where she lives, and used her savings to buy her first sewing machines.  Luz works alone on a daily basis, but sometimes gets help from another person, depending on the number of orders she has.

The loan Luz is asking for would strengthen her ability to work.  With the money she will buy goods to supply her workshop, such as fabric, thread, needles, lace and buttons.   Luz says her main challenge is competition in the market place  However, this challenge motivates her to keep providing better services and fighting for her dream.  Her dream is that her business will becomn accredited, allowing her to provide employment opportunities to others.  In that way she will raise her standard of living and that of the people who join in the work.

loans.use: to buy sewing goods to supply her workshop, such as fabric, thread,needles, lace and buttons

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura is 52 year old, married, with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 22 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. Safura usually sells her crop from her house. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and they also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 240 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and working in the open air; it is very hard for a woman. That is why her spouse helps. Safura needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers as well as new garden tools. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and to increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she has applied for 500 AZN. This will be her 4TH loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizers as well as new garden tools

loans.name: Moyiapai

texts.en:
Moyiapai is a 43 year old widow and has been blessed with seven children who look up to to her for their upkeep. She has been a dairy farmer for twelve years, earning an income of KES. 12,200 at the end of every month.

Moyiapai was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now servicing her first loan of KES.20,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy animal feeds. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future full of success.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 47 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable , vive con su esposa y dos hijos pues los demás ya se acompañaron.

Rodolfo cultiva la tierra desde muy pequeño, ya que trabajaba con sus padres, hoy en día don él cultiva maíz y espera que los resultados de la cosecha sean positivos pues le servirá para obtener ganancias y cubrir sus gastos familiares.


El crédito lo utilizará para comprar los insumos agrícolas como (Fertilizantes , insecticidas , fungicidas, herbicidas y foliares).

Su plan a futuro es cultivar hortalizas  con la ayuda de un crédito.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 47 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible person. He lives with his wife and two of his children, since the rest live on their own with their partners. Rodolfo has been farming since he was very young, since he started working alongside his parents. Today he grows corn and hopes the harvest will yield good results, because that would allow him to make a profit and cover his family's expenses.

He will use this loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizer, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, and foliar products.

His plans for the future are to grow vegetables with help from a loan.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dusica

texts.en: Dusica, 44 years old, is the mother of two children; she works in administrative work while her husband receives social help. They are living in one of the minority communities in Kosovo, in a very old and small house. Because of their low income, they have not been able to complete any renovations or repairs necessary in the past. Now she is requesting a loan in order to façade the house, improving the living conditions for her and her family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders. This loan will help to improve the living conditions and offer her children a better education.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Miodrag

texts.en: Miodrag is living in a minority community of Kosovo and is married with two children. He is working in a clinic while his wife works in a private business. To make more money and provide for his family, he recently opened a food shop. He has many plans for his business but, for the time being, he only wants to gather enough capital to expand it. He is requesting a loan to purchase food and products for his market. He is very happy for the financial support that KosInvest gives and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase food and products for his market

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 44 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four currently in school. For the past eight years, Edward has been working hard to manage his business selling refrigerators. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more refrigerators and will help Edward generate greater profit and expand his business. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his stock. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more refrigerators.

loans.name: Waiswa

texts.en:
Waiswa is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mayuge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Waiswa has been working hard to manage his phone accessories business, which sells phones. 

To help expand his business, Waiswa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy phones and phone covers, and will help Waiswa to generate greater profits and increase stock. Waiswa hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Waiswa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Waiswa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone covers.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Dan has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand his business, Dan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Dan to generate greater profits and expand the business. Dan hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big clinic. 

Dan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for his drug shop.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Margie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Margie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.  She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money to have a more formal establishment. Janet is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Maricon is 49 years old and married with four children, one in school. Maricon works very hard to provide for her family.

Maricon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maricon has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Maricon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marjan

texts.en: Marjan, 32, is the father of three children, ages 1 to 9 years old. He is working in a kindergarten while his wife is a housewife taking care of their home and children. Because they live with only one salary, he is not able to save any extra money or pay for things other than their daily needs. His wife has been searching for employment but has not been able to find anything. Now, he is in need of a loan to purchase wood for heating later in the winter. Purchasing during this season is much cheaper and he would be able to get larger quantities. He is very grateful for the help and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase wood for heating later in the winter

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta octavo grado no continuo sus estudios por la economía en que Vivían, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Por lo tanto, son los que dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja como lanchero en una empresa de turismo, mientras que María se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 10 años, trabajo que lo aprendió junto a su esposo y de sus padres. María no se traslada para realizar su trabajo, pues lo hace en su propia casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar de una a dos vacas, así podrá obtener un mayor ingreso y podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

María sueña con que sus hijos estudien, para que sean unos profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and a homemaker. She has an eighth grade education and didn't stay in school due to her family's financial situation. She is married and has three children who are all in school. They are her only dependants. Her husband works driving a motorboat for a tourism company, while María has been raising animals for ten years. She learned this work alongside her husband and her parents. Mary doesn't need to travel for her work, since she raises her animals at home.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy one or two cows, which will allow her to make more income and give her family a better quality of life.

María wants her children to stay in school in order to earn a professional degree and become upstanding people.

loans.use: to buy one or two cows.

loans.name: Liria Rosa

texts.es:
Liria es una mujer de 41 años de edad madre de dos hijos por los cuales tuvo que abandonar muchas aspiraciones y sueños en la vida como estudiar una carrera universitaria pues tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y cubrir los gastos que un hijo demanda. 

Encontró en la venta de mercancía a través de catalogo como lociones, cremas, maquillaje y ropa la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de sus hijos y conseguir recursos para su sostenimiento.

Hoy en día solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercancía como ropa, lociones y otros artículos de belleza, reforzando así su inventario y mejorando su actividad.

Con este préstamo estarás apoyando a una madre colombiana con gran amor y dedicación para su hijo, con empuje y tenacidad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liria is a 41 year old woman, mother of two children, for whose sake she has set aside many hopes and dreams of her own, such as studying for a college degree.  She had to take care of her children and cover the costs that a child involves.   She found a way to generate a good income while still being with her children, through the sale of catalog merchandise such as lotions, creams, makeup and clothing.  She was able to get resources to support them.

Currently Liria is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, lotions, and cosmetic items to stock her inventory and improve her work.  This loan provides support to a Colombian woman who works with great love and dedication for her children, with the drive and tenacity to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise such as clothing, lotions, and cosmetic items to stock her business

loans.name: Milorad

texts.en:
Milorad is widowed at age 55 and lives with his children in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. He is currently employed in a clinic in the area and his son is employed with a private company. His life had been difficult raising his children without a wife and he had to work hard to offer his children better living conditions. 

One of the ways that he would like to improve their situation is that he would like to use the yard in front of their home as a summer kitchen. With this, they will be able to enjoy the season together as a family and the weather. He would not be able to do this without borrowing the money and does not want to ask anyone for help. This loan will help him to finally achieve his dream and he appreciates the help and support from the lenders.

loans.use: To build a summer kitchen

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 32 years old, lives with her husband, four children and her widower father in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 
Yen is a construction worker along with her husband. The couple commutes to work by taking their motorbike. The old motorbike is breaking down and uses more gasoline than a new one. Facing this, Yen decided to request a loan to replace a new motorbike. 
Yen and her husband are in picture.

loans.use: To replace her motorbike.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 44 years, married and with his wife have been blessed with four children, ages 6 to 20.

Noah sells timber, a business he has had for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. Noah has requested his third loan of KES 54,000 to purchase trees for his business. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Noah will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase trees

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall by trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Rukia is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is 30 years old and lives in Buyamba local area in Uganda. He has three children that he looks after. He has been banana farming for the last four years. He also runs a business using his motorcycle as a taxi.  He says he started boda boda (motorcycle transport) to supplement the earnings from his plantation. 
He says he managed to acquire the motorcycle through a UGAFODE asset acquisition loan, which has increased his income. He has also managed to buy a cow that has given him some milk to improve his household diet and sells part of the milk to supplement his income.
He hopes to use the loan of 300,000 UGX to buy mulch for his plantation, which currently is suffering through a dry spell, to avoid loss of soil moisture affecting his yields. He says that the UGAFODE loan has been a major stepping stone to his success.

loans.use: to buy mulches.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is 42, divorced and the father of two children, one girl and one boy between the ages 9 and 12 years old. He is employed by an electrical company and lives alone, since his children are living with his ex-wife. 

Despite the fact that he lives alone, he is very optimistic and wants to improve his living conditions. His house is very old and he has decided for the first time to request a loan in order to renovate the house and facade. This loan will help him to have a better standard of living and conditions. He wants to thank all of the lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Saroeng

texts.en:
Saroeung, age 50, lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh. She has been married since 2000 and has four sons and one daughter. One of her children is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other two are still young. 

Saroeung is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a rice farmer and raises a cow at home. He wants to buy another cow to raise so Saroeung is asking for a loan in order to buy a cow for her husband. Saroeung and her husband are in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Mulwa

texts.en:
Mulwa is a 50-year-old man.  He is married to Janet who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family and they are blessed with four children. Mulwa has been operating a transportation business for six years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Mulwa is servicing his second loan of KES 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to add to his personal savings to buy an additional motorcycle.

Mulwa plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and to purchase his own land to build a permanent house for his family.  He hopes to improve the living standard of his family and to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to add to his personal savings to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Sukaiman

texts.en:
Sukaiman is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Sukaiman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho (grits), soap, bread, groundnuts and soya flour. 

To help expand his business, Sukaiman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts and soya flour, and will help Sukaiman to generate greater profits. Sukaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to develop. 

Sukaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Sukaiman, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho (grits), soap, bread, groundnuts and soya flour.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 47-years-old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Musa has been working hard to manage his butchery business, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Musa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows, and will help Musa to generate greater profits and increase supply. Musa hopes that in the future he will be able to develop. 

Musa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Musa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Sokthin

texts.en:
Sokthin is age 34 years, married with two children, and living with his wife and two children in a rural village of the Stoeng Sen District. He and his wife make a living through working as paid workers. Having been in this business for five years, together they can earn about US $4 per day to support their family. 

Sokthin is a client in his second cycle with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan to pay for his university tuition in order to study finance and banking. He hopes this loan will enable him to study until graduation, so as to have a good and bright future.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fees.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 57-years-old and married. Mercedes works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods, sardines, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Hamisi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour. 

To help expand his business, Hamisi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour, and will help Hamisi to generate greater profits and earn more. Hamisi hopes that in the future he will be able to develop. 

Hamisi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamisi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour to sell.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and children in suburb of Phnom Penh. She is a garment factory worker.

Sarin commutes by bicycle; taking the bicycle is tiring and time spending. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan in order to purchase a motorbike.

Sarin and her husband are in picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 36-years-old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his welding business, which welds gates. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new welding machine, and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and expand the business. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to have more stock for customers. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso is a 29-year-old man married to Florence, who adds additional income to support their family, and are blessed with two children.  Mutiso has been a farmer alongside with a transportation business for a period of seven years earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Mutiso was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm produce and to repair one of his motorcycles which has mechanical challenges.

Mutiso plans to use the anticipated income to boost his wife's grocery business and hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y tiene un hijo.

Santos vive con su familia y se  dedica a comercializar bovinos y especies menores ya que tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, él compra ganado y revende, desde hace 8 años realiza esta actividad y ha sido la fuente de ingresos durante todo este tiempo.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos bovinos para criarlos y después venderlos a buen precio.

Sus planes a futuro son seguir trabajando con los programas de créditos  y llegar a tener su corral con sus animales ya que sueña con tener vacas lecheras para poder trabajar con lácteos y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old, only studied until the third grade, has a partner and a son.

Santos lives with his family and makes a living selling cattle and smaller animals since he has a lot of experience in this business. For the last 8 years he has bought and resold cattle and it has been his source of income for all this time.

He needs the loan to buy two calves to raise and then resell at a good price.

His future plans are to continue working with the lending programs and end up having an animal pen. He dreams of having milk cows to be able to work with dairy and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy two calves to raise and then sell at a good price.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 49 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which rears chicken. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken feed, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and increase stock. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to gain personal development. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Dada

texts.en:
Dada is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past ten years, Dada has been working hard to manage his furniture shop, which sells furniture. 

To help expand his business, Dada has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy wood and materials to make chairs and will help Dada to generate greater profits to increase capital. Dada hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger business. 

Dada is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dada who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials to make chairs

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Amos has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Amos has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour, and will help Amos to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Amos hopes that in the future he will be able to increase stock. 

Amos is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amos who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour to sell.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past seven years, Kenneth has been working hard to manage his video library. 

To help expand his business, Kenneth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase DVDs, and will help Kenneth to generate greater profits and improve services. Kenneth hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Kenneth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kenneth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 45-years-old and married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emelia has a business selling fruits and root crops in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and root crops to sell in her food stall.

Emelia has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and root crops to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dorelia

texts.es:
Doriela es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.

Todo comenzó hace más de 10 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la practica aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 45 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller y trabaja todos los días de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina plana y una fileteadora, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.

Doriela sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Doriela, 45, is a dedicated and hardworking micro-entrepreneur.  She's a dressmaker who works for third parties.  It all began more than 10 years ago when she worked in a garment shop and learned the trade on the job.  Now she has her own shop and works every day to generate enough income to help her husband with the financial responsibility for the household.

The loan she's requesting will be invested in a sewing machine and an overlock machine so she can fill her customers' requests and orders in a timely manner.  Her goal is to increase her production and acquire new contracts so she can continue with her small business.

Doriela dreams of continuing to strengthen her workshop and of having a higher level of production every day.  She dreams of generating new job opportunities and improving the quality of life not only of her family but also of the people who affect her work every day.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlock machine

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 54 years old, widowed, and has seven children between the ages of 29 and 12. For the last five years, she has been running a retail shop where she sells assorted food items. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to buy more maize flour, sugar, and trays of eggs for resale.  

Eunice will use the anticipated profits to increase her inventory and, in the future, open a wholesale store for a variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 34-year-old, married man with two children attending different schools. He is a farmer and also deals in a backcloth business. He works for 4 days a week and 7 hours a day and was motivated by the fact it was his area of expertise.

He also deals in a passion fruit business where he gains an additional income that he uses to meet the needs of his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy more passion fruits to sell in his business. He is targeting hotels and restaurants that usually buy in bulk and at a good price.

He sells his products to local people around Manyama trading centre and surrounding areas. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to a larger scale. He faces a challenge of poor weather conditions like drought, which affects his business. He is described as a shrewd man in business, and is appreciative of the services offered by Ugafode Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits to sell.

loans.name: Swaliki

texts.en:
Swaliki is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Swaliki has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells groundnuts. 

To help expand his business, Swaliki has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more groundnuts, and will help Swaliki to generate greater profits and increase production. Swaliki hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Swaliki is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Swaliki who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts

loans.name: Hekima Garden Group

texts.en:
Halima is a mother of two children (a boy and a girl) who are still at school. She is in her early thirties and not married. She runs a fish business, which she fries fish herself, a business she has been with for five years. She normally goes to the fish market from 11 a.m. until evening when she gets back home. She starts to fry them from 6 p.m. and at the same time selling up until midnight. She is really working hard and she is doing all of this for her children’s lives. She is able to receive a fair monthly profit.

Halima is requesting her first loan to be apportioned between Hekima Garden, a fourteen-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans. She will invest her portion to restock fish to her business. She desires to open a successful enterprise.

loans.use: to restock fish to her business.

loans.name: William Enrique

texts.es:
El señor William a sus 65 años de edad es un hombre que tiene grandes responsabilidades las cuales son mantener 3 hijos que viven con y depende de él y a su pareja, hace poco quedo desempleado y a su avanzada edad ya es muy difícil que lo empleen.

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, para William es muy importante el crédito pues será lo único que lograra mantener a su familia y por sus problemas de salud no puede ejercer otra profesión por eso pide con todo el corazón una ayuda para sacar a su familia adelante. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de surtido, como productos de aseo general, abarrotes, panela, salsas, aceite, chocolate etc. granos como arroz, frijol, sal, azúcar entre otros y adecuar y terminar su local, también en un refrigerador y productos congelados, mortadela, salchichas, leches etc.  

Sueña con tener su tienda y poder ser feliz y brindar un apoyo incondicional a su familia.
texts.en:
At 65 years old, William is a man with great responsibilities which are to maintain three children who live with and depend on him and his partner. He recently became unemployed and at his advanced age it is very difficult to find employment.

He is requesting a loan to open a store for basic food products. This loan is very important for William since it will be the only way he will manage to maintain his family. He can not practice another profession due to his health problems which is why he is asking for help, with all of his heart, to help his family move forward.

He will invest the loan in purchasing supplies, such as general cleaning products, groceries, sugarcane, sauces, oil and chocolate, grains such as rice, beans, salt and sugar among others. He will fix up and finish his shop and also buy a refrigerator and frozen products, bologna, sausages, milk, etc.

He dreams of having a store, being happy and providing unconditional support to his family.

loans.use: to fix up his store and the area, to buy a refrigerator, cleaning products like mops, brooms, disinfectants, grains such as beans, rice, groceries such as chocolate and oil, frozen and refrigerated products such as chicken, milk, cheese and sausages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres En Accion De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Dúo: Mujeres En Acción de San Martin
Dúo formado por maría Juana, origianria del área de Chimaltenango. ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos y marranos, estos animales tienen mucha demanda en el área donde ella vive. Está agradecida con la fundación y Kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que por medio de eso está logrando el sueño de enviar a sus hijos a la escuela. En sus pagos ha sido bien responsable. Solicita el crédito para la compra de concentrado, gallinas y vitaminas para sus pollos y marranos.
texts.en:
This twosome is called the San Martin Mujeres in Acción (Women in Action). One of the members is María Juana. She is from the Chimaltenango area and earns her living raising chickens and pigs, both of which are much in demand locally. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support they have given her. As a result she is fulfilling her dream of sending her children to school.

She has been paying back the loan in a responsible manner. Now she is seeking another loan to buy specialized feed, more chickens, and vitamins for the chickens and pigs.

loans.use: Buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Edmond has been working hard to manage his video library, which sells beers and DVDs. 

To help expand his business, Edmond has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more DVDs and beers, and will help Edmond to generate greater profits and increase capital. Edmond hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Edmond is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edmond who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and beers for his business.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is married and has been blessed with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. She dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José trabaja junto con su esposa en un terreno que compraron y han venido forjando hace aproximadamente 12 años con inconvenientes de conflicto armado de difícil temporada, de sequías.

Se enfrenta con un problema y es que está atravesando por la legalización de sus cultivos  para lo que necesita capital para no perder sus tierras por eso la única manera de generar ingresos en aprovechando su tierra. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos y preparar la tierra, necesita abonos, riegos, fertilizantes y un campo para cubrir sus terrenos contra el invierno. 

Sueña con tener sus parcelas legalizadas y vivir junto con su familia y dos hijos de 17 y 7 años tranquilamente gozando de la madre tierra.
texts.en:
José works with his wife on a plot of land they bought and have built up for approximately 12 years, through problems with armed conflict and periods of drought.

He's faced with a problem going through the process of legalizing his crops, for which he needs capital so he won't lose them.  The only way to generate income is to make the most of his land.

He's requesting a loan to buy inputs to prepare the soil.  He needs soil amendments, fertilizer, irrigation supplies, and a pasture to cover up his land against the winter.

He dreams of having his land legalized and of living peacefully and enjoying Mother Earth with his family and two children, ages 17 and 7.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, and irrigation supplies to prepare the soil

loans.name: Abel Ulises

texts.es:
Abel tiene 57 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de nivel académico, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios  domésticos, ha procreado 5 hijos de los cuales tres están en la escuela y dos le ayuda en los los trabajos agrícolas y ganadería, solo sus hijos y esposa dependen de Abel.

Abel se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre con el objetivo de que en un futuro pudieran defenderse, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 5 minutos de su casa y se va a pie. Abel también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, esto lo aprendió por un amigo suyo desde hace 5 años.


El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para pagar mozos  que le ayuden a chapodar la tierra para sembrar la milpa, ya que quiere tener todo listo con anticipación.


El sueño de Abel es que Dios le de vida para seguir trabajando con el ganado ya que tiene muy buenas ganancias de ello.
texts.en:
Abel is 57 years old, has a third grade level education, and lives together with his partner who takes care of the domestic work. He has five children, three of which are in school and two that help with the farming and cattle raising. Only his kids and wife depend on Abel. 

Abel has made a living in farming since he was 14 years old. His father taught him this job with the goal that in the future they would be able to support themselves. This job is a 5 minute distance from his house and he can get there by foot. Abel additionally makes a living in the buying and selling of livestock, which he learned from his friend 5 years ago. 

The loan he is requesting from CreditCampo is needed to pay the young boys that help him chop down the land in order to sow the fields. He wants to have everything ready in advance. 

Abel's dream is that God will allow him to continue working with the livestock as he has received very good profits from it.

loans.use: to pay the young boys that help him chop down the land in order to sow the fields as he wants to have everything ready in advance.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and increase capital. Godfrey hopes that in the future, he will be able to have growth in the business. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, bread, groundnuts, and soya flour.

loans.name: Lucelly De Jesus

texts.es:
Lucelly, a sus 59 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, comenzó a comercializar productos como cremas, lociones, maquillaje, entre otros, en un local ubicado en el municipio de Bello; vendiendo productos para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para realizar algunas mejoras locativas a su negocio, compra de estanterías y compra de surtido como helados, artículos de papelería, artículos de belleza, entre otros.

Así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Lucelly manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de productos variados y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Lucelly, at her 59 years of age, is a charismatic, active and service-oriented woman. 

Being the mother of two has been the main driver in her daily, tireless struggle to earn a living and bring money to her children. 

For about 20 years, she has been marketing products such as creams, lotions, makeup, etc., in a shop located in the town of Bello; selling products for all types of customers, of good quality and at low prices, which allowed her to become a known player in this business sector. 

This success encourages her to apply for a loan to support certain improvements to her business: buy shelves and stock her inventory with ice cream, stationery, beauty items, and more. 

This way she will meet demand this season, which will help her improve the earnings from her labor. 

Lucelly shows that her age is not an impediment stopping her from doing what she is passionate about. She always sets  new goals for herself and among them is one of becoming a great distributor of various products, and thereby create employment opportunities, which in turn will improve the well-being of not just her family but also of the families of those who assist her in performing her daily work.

loans.use: make some improvements to her business, and buy shelves and inventory like ice cream, stationery, beauty products, and others.

loans.name: Khuon's Group

texts.en:
Khuon is 53 years old and a married mother blessed with one kid. She is a villager from Preah Vihear province. She struggles for a living via cassava, soybean, and bananas. This is not the first loan for Khuon. She has fully repaid back her past loan completely, and she can improve her lifestyle gradually and can keep her kids in school. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For Khuon, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel to generate electricity. She hopes that she can have electricity.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel to generate electricity

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 24-year-old hardworking woman married to Nzioka, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family; they are blessed with two children.  Naomi has been operating a milk sales business shop for three years, earning her an income of KES. 5,000 at the end of every month.

Naomi was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor, and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 5,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy fresh dairy milk to sell to her clients on a daily basis.

Naomi plans to use the anticipated income to open a grocery stall, pay school fees for her children, and hopes to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fresh dairy milk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Vianney has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beer, water, spirits, and soda. 

To help expand his business, Vianney has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock beer, water, spirits and soda, and will help Vianney to generate greater profits and expand the business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to grow in the business. 

Vianney is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vianney who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock beer, water, spirits, and soda

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
