Benard is 42 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Benard has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells beer, water, spirits and soda. 

To help expand his business, Benard has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock beer, water, spirits, and soda, and will help Benard to generate greater profits and improve his welfare. Benard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Benard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock beer, water, spirits, and soda

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has been operating a general store in their village for many years, and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business.  She always finds ways to improve her business, for she want to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. 

Wanting to increase sales, she took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell.

In the future, Lourdes will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college, and also to support them with their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 30 years old.  He is married and his wife is also a business lady.  Together they work in the same business.  He has been in business for six years.  He is requesting the loan to buy more items such as biscuits, tomato paste and cooking oil to sell. 

The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, tomato paste and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
Carine is 28 years old.  She is married to a businessman and together they run the business.  

Carine has a stationary shop and she has been running it as a business for five years.  With this loan, she will buy more books, toner cartridges and other scholastic materials to sell.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy books, toner cartridges and scholarstic materials.

loans.name: Elifaz

texts.en:
Elifaz is 45 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has three children; none of them are currently in school. For the past 19 years, Elifaz has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, ground nuts, and soya flour. 

To help expand his business, Elifaz has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, ground nuts and soya flour, and will help Elifaz to generate greater profits and acquire a fridge and sell cold drinks. Elifaz hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Elifaz is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elifaz who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, salt, bread, ground nuts, and soya flour

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Ravy is 30 years old and single.  She lives with her brother, her sister and her widower father in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ravy sells noodles with soup from her home.  She wants to buy the neighboring land to expand the land associated with her property.  Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her property.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 27 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past eight years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, and salt. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, and salt, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and increase stock. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand business. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, posho, soap, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase medication and pay for medical visits.

loans.name: Dúo Chajones Group

texts.es:
DUO CHAJONES
Este dúo formado por doña Gloria Florencia, de 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella nos cuenta que se dedica desde hace 6 años a la venta de artículos de consumo diario que tiene ubicado en su casa,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de algunos productos que aun no tiene en su negocio como verduras y un poco de frutas, también comprando más productos como aguas, pastas de dientes y para comer, jabón, detergente, golosinas etc.
texts.en: The Duo Chajones partnership was formed by Gloria Florencia.  She is 38 years old, is married and has four children.  She tells us that for the past six years, she has worked selling food on a daily basis from her home.  She is seeking a loan to purchase some products that she still does not have in her business such as vegetables and some fruits, as well as water, toothpaste, soap, detergent, snacks, etc....

loans.use: purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman; she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nadzua has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 44-year-old married man with three children and two dependents; all are in school. He is farmer who grows bananas for sale, and the surplus for home consumption. He works six days a week and six hours a day, and was motivated by the fact it required less capital.

He also deals in cattle business, like fattening, from which he gains an additional income that he uses to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy three cows that he will graze and later sell at a profit when he has fattened them.

He sells his products to local people around his locality and surrounding areas. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to a sustainable point so that he doesn't have to borrow again. He is described as shrewd man in business, and is appreciative of the services offered by Ugafode Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
María de 64 años de edad, es ama de casa, no pudo estudiar por la pobreza en que sus padres vivían, esta viuda y es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados y tienen su propio hogar, por lo tanto ya no depende de ella, María vive con una de sus hijas y tres nietos.

María se dedica a la compra de ganado de repasto los cuales los vende en 12 meses, trabajo que aprendió gracias a su esposo, así obtiene ingresos para pagar sus gastos y también para poder cancelar su crédito. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos novillas y así poder aumentar un poco más sus ingresos para darse la alimentación necesaria.

El sueño de ella es tener 10 vacas lecheras sin tener créditos.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and a homemaker. She was unable to get an education due to the poverty her parents were living in. She is a widow, and the mother of seven children who are all already married and who have their own home, therefore they are no longer her dependent children. Maria lives with one of her daughters and three grandchildren.

Maria makes a living from the purchase of grazing cattle that she sells twelve months later. She learned this work thanks to her husband, and she obtains in this way the income to pay her expenses and also to repay her loan.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy two heifers, in order to be able to increase her income a little more to meet her own food needs.

Her dream is to own ten dairy cows without outstanding loans.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Renovación se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Santa Martha en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 53 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvieron 8 hijos mayores de edad, cuatro  de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Ross con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, toallas, perfumes, bisuterías, entre otras cosas, ella tiene unas vitrinas en su casa en las cuales exhibe sus productos aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza bajo pedidos. Trabaja todos los días ya que si no sale está en su local, ella deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 8 años  en esta actividad que le sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, bisuterías, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Renovacion" meets every 15 days in the Santa Martha neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This is a city known for its beautiful beaches.  The city receives a lot of visitors in every season of the year, and it is also known as a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Rosa, 53, lives.  Her husband died a number of years ago leaving her a widow, but from this relationship she has 8 grown children.  Four of her children still live with her in her house.  

In order to have her own income and to get ahead, Rosa has a business selling clothing, sheets, towels, perfumes, accessories, and other items.  She has glass display cases in her house where she exhibits her products, although most of her sales are made on the basis of advance orders.  Rosa works every day, because if she doesn't go out to sell she is in her shop.  She sells her products on credit and collects every week or 2 weeks, according to the wishes of her customers.  She's had this business for more than 8 years, and the business has been her means of getting ahead.

Rosa will use this loan to buy clothing, accessories, perfumes, and other items to sell.  She's been a member of her communal bank since the start, and she likes it because of the benefits and the loans that the institution offers.  Her dream is to continue forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 28 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children, one of whom currently attends school.  For the past four years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his hardware business, which sells hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more hardware items, and will help Jackson generate greater profits and improve his standard of living.  Jackson hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
Cándida Rosa es una señora de 59 años, casada, madre de tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, tiene a cargo dos nietos los cuales dependen de ella.
Ella habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde nació, creció y formó su hogar.
Doña Rosita como es conocida cariñosamente en el barrio de Subtiava tiene el negocio de una Pulpería ubicada en su vivienda en la cual ofrece abarrotería en general, este negocio tiene más de diez años de tenerlo el cual es bien concurrido por los habitantes por la amabilidad con la que a tiende ella.
En este momento doña Rosita necesita de capital de trabajo para invertirlo en el negocio con el cual piensa comprar arroz, pollo, azúcar, jabón, gaseosas y café, ya que viene la temporada buena del invierno donde las personas del campo adquieren los productos para el hogar.
Por tal motivo se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva, esperando y confiando en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa is a 59 year old married mother of three adult children.  She has two grandchildren under her care who depend on her.  She lives in the town of El Sauce where she was born, raised, and started her family.  Rosita, as she is known affectionately in the Subtiava neighborhood, has a small grocery store located in her home, where she sells general groceries.  She has owned this building for the past ten years, and it is very heavily visited by the residents because of the kindness with which she tends to her customers.  

At this moment, Rosita needs working capital to invest in her business.  She plans to purchase rice, chicken, sugar, soap, sofa and coffee since winter is coming, and this is when people from the countryside come an purchase their household goods.  For this reason, she went to Ceprodel in search of a loan with the help of the Kica lenders.  She is hoping and trusting in God that her request will be approved.

loans.use: purchase rice, chicken, sugar, soap, soda and coffee.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, neither of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, beans, posho (maize flour) and soap. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  sugar, salt, beans, posho and soap, and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and earn a higher income. Yusuf hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, salt, beans, posho and soap

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Renovación se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Santa Martha en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres, ella está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos puede surtir su negocio el cual le sirve para salir adelante.
Doña Ana es una joven que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en casa de la abuela, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, granos, legumbres y ciertos productos de papelería, le encanta su negocio ya que allí ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante y con esto forjarse un mejor porvenir.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The Renovación lending group meets every two weeks in the Santa Martha neighborhood of the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches  that are heavily visited year round, and for being a city of unmatched beauty with many tourist attractions.  Ana lives in this city.  She is 24, single and lives at home with her parents.  She has been a part of the lending group since its inception, and she likes it because she is able to stock her business with the loan, which allows her to get ahead.  

Ana is a young woman who likes to get ahead and help with the household expenses since her family is poor.  She has a small grocery store in her grandmother's house.  There, she sells all kinds of basic goods like, grains, legumes and certain paper products.  She likes her business because it allows her to earn an income to get ahead and build a better future.

This loan will be used to purchase groceries to stock her store.  Her dream is to have a larger and better stocked store.

loans.use: purchase food supplies.

loans.name: María Adelaida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Renovación se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Santa Martha en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, ella está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque es así como ella sale adelante junto  a sus hijos.
Doña María es una muy buena madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto  sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, casi  todos los días ella  recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos  aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 6 años en esta actividad con la cual trata de que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar camisas, pantalones, blusas entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Renovación lending group meets every 15 days in the Santa Martha neighborhood in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are heavily visited year round, and for being a city with unmatched beauty and many tourist attractions.

María lives in this city.  She is 36 years old, and is a single mother of two children ages 16 and 14 who attend high school.  She has been part of the lending group since its inception, and she enjoys it because it allows her to get ahead with her children.  María is a great mother who in order to earn an income and get her children ahead, she works selling all types of clothing. She makes her sales by going door-to-door, and she goes out to sell her products throughout the city almost every day.  She also sells out of her house when customers come searching for some clothing item.  She makes sales on credit and she collects on a weekly basis.  She has been in the business for over six years, and she does her best to make sure that her children never lack anything.

This loan will be used to purchase shirts, pants, blouses and other items.  Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: purchase shirts, pants, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his spare parts business, which sells tires, tubes, wheels and paddles.

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to  purchase tires, tubes, wheels and paddles, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and increase stock. Charles hopes that, in the future, he will be able to meet target plans. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase tires, tubes, wheels and paddles

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his poultry business, selling layers and eggs. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicks and poultry feed, and will help Charles to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Charles hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand the business. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Yadira Marcela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Renovación se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Santa Martha en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Yadira, tiene 28 años de edad, es divorciada y de este compromiso tiene un hijo de 8 años el cual vive con el padre,  actualmente mantiene una relación de unión de la cual tiene un  hijo de dos años de edad. El marido es productor de sonidos.
Doña Yadira junto a su marido tiene un local en el cual realizan trabajos de publicidad  para radio, televisión o escrita, ellos también realizan animaciones para fiestas, eventos y promociones con sonidos, tienen muchos contratos para realizar estos trabajos ya que son muy cumplidos cuando un cliente necesita de un trabajo y a ellos le gusta cumplir para seguir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar unos micrófonos y amplificadores que necesita para realizar un mejor trabajo. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
The credit group Renovacion meets every two weeks in the Santa Martha neighborhood of the city of Manta, which is a city known for its beautiful beaches which are frequented all year round and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Yadira, 28, lives in this place.  She is divorced and from this union she has a son, 8, who lives with the father.  Nowadays, she is in a civil union from which she has a son two years old.  Her husband is a sound producer.
Yadira and her husband have a place where they produce radio, television and print publicity.  They also produce animations for parties, events and sound promotions.  They have many contracts to produce this work so that they are very busy when a customer needs a job done and they like to comply in order to move ahead.
She will use this loan to buy some microphones and amplifiers which they need to produce better work.  She has gone through four cycles with the credit group and she likes it because the loans are a big help.  Her dream is to have a proper location for her work.

loans.use: to buy microphones and amplifiers.

loans.name: Amani Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Selina, who is in her late 30's, is married and has four children, two in school and two still small. She has been a food vendor for two years, working from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily. Selina is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Selina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and she will use it to restock the missing food items in her food stall. She dreams of owning a clothing sales business. 

Selina will share this loan with her loan group "AMANI KIBAHA" which consists of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing food items in her stall

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian, 29 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Vivian works hard to provide for her family. For the past nine years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from fish vending. Vivian has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Vivian aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 34 years old. He is married, and he operates a food stall. He has been running a business for ten years. With the loan, he would like to buy more maize flour and salts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour and salts for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 30 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past four years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his business, which sells maize flour, millet flour, and beans. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy maize flour, millet flour, and beans, and will help Gerald to earn more profits. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, millet flour, and beans

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio nació en Satipo, departamento de Junin entre la sierra y selva peruana y vino a Lima para estudiar y poder superarse en la vida. Sus familia se encuentra en su lugar de origen y el vive solo en la capital junto a su hermano mayor quien lo ayuda económicamente ya que sus padres apenas ganan lo suficiente para sobrevivir con lo que les generan la venta de frutas y tubérculos que cosechan en su chacra.
El estudia administración de empresas y actualmente cursa su ultimo ciclo y esta próximo a graduarse, sin embargo problemas económicos podrían impedir que cumpla sus sueños de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El esta muy interesado en seguir estudiando y convalidar sus estudios técnicos en alguna universidad que se lo permita para así poder profundizar sus conocimientos en el área de recursos humanos, área donde le gustaría desempeñarse al ser profesional.
El desea pedirle y a su vez agradecer el apoyo que puedan brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva para dar este ultimo paso hacia su titulo profesional, ademas quiere decirles que el trabajara desde el primer momento para poder garantizar la devolución del préstamo que le darán, ya que entiende que gracias a ese dinero el podra estudiar y acabar su carrera y que el devolverlo es vital para que los prestamistas de Kiva puedan seguir ayudando a jóvenes deseosos de cumplir sus sueños, donde el considera que la educación es punto vital para conseguirlos.
texts.en:
Juan was born in Satipo, a region of Junin between the mountains and Peruvian rain forest. He came to Lima in order to study and to be able to excel in life. His family lives in their hometown and he lives alone in the capital with his older brother who helps him financially since his parents barely earn enough to survive with what they make selling the fruits and tubers that they harvested on the their farm. 

He studies business administration and currently is taking his final course. He is close to graduating however financial problems may prevent from fulfilling him dreams if he does not have the support of Kiva lenders. 

He is very interested in continuing to study and having his technical courses officially recognized by a university. In doing this, he will be able to expand his knowledge in human resources, an area that he would like to work in as a professional. 

He wishes to ask and at the same thank the Kiva investors for their support in taking this final step towards his professional degree. Additionally he wants to say that he will work from the outset to ensure the repayment of the loan they're giving him. He understands that thanks to this money he will be able to study and finish his career and that the repayment is vital for Kiva investors to continue helping young eager people fulfill their dreams. He believes education is the vital point for achieving those dreams.

loans.use: to complete his last course of studies in industrial management

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Renovación se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Santa Martha en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 9 y 7 años que estudian en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres. 
Doña María con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con estos sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, bisuterías, entre otras cosas, ella sale todos los días en las mañanas ya que aprovecha que sus hijos están en sus escuelas para salir con más comodidad aunque también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, lleva más de 8 años  en esta actividad que le sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, zapatos, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group Renovación meets every 15 days in the Santa Martha neighborhood in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are well-visited during all seasons of the year, and for being a city with an unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Maria lives in this location. She's 36 years old and a single mother of two children who are 7 and 9 years old and study in school. She lives in her parents' house.

Maria earns her living selling clothing, shoes, handbags, perfumes and jewelry, among other things, with the aim of earning her own income and bringing up her children. She leaves every day in the morning, taking advantage of the fact that her children are in school to leave more comfortably. 

She also sells from home, where her most regular customers come. She sells her goods on credit and charges weekly or every two weeks in accordance with what her clients want. She's been doing this business, which lets her get ahead, for more than eight years.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, handbags and shoes, among other things she sells. She's been in the loan group from its beginning and enjoys it because the loans help her move forward. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Natanael

texts.es:
La pasión y el espíritu emprendedor de Jorge lo llevaron a tener su propio negocio, el cual en un principio era su pasatiempo. A las 7:00 am, Jorge, de 24 años, limpia sus herramientas de trabajo, el cepillo de peinar, la máquina de cortar cabello, las tijeras, la crema de afeitar y otros objetos que son indispensables en su barbería. Desde hace 3 años, decidió hacer de su pasatiempo un ingreso para apoyar a su madre en el hogar, pues desde que salió de la secundaria no había podido conseguir un trabajo y tampoco pudo ir a la universidad por sus bajos recursos económicos. 
Jorge tiene su negocio en casa, pues cuenta con el apoyo completo de su mamá, pero sueña con algún día moverse al centro de la ciudad, no obstante, no tiene otros ingresos para ampliar su negocio como espera hacer. Por esta razón necesita de un préstamo para vender perfumes, acondicionadores, gel para el cabello, entre otros productos para la higiene personal para ofrecer un servicio completo a sus clientes. La visión de este joven emprendedor está establecida, pues en un futuro planea comprar una refrigeradora para poder vender bebidas en su negocio y así ofrecer una mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial passion and spirit of Jorge led him to have his own business which was at first his pastime. At 7:00 am, Jorge, 24 years old, cleans his work tools, hair brush, hair clippers, scissors, shaving cream and other objects which are indispensable in his barbershop. He decided to turn his pastime into income 3 years ago to support his mother at home. He has not been able to find work since he left high school and was also unable to go to university due to his low income.

Since Jorge has his business in his home he has the complete support of his mother but he dreams of one day moving to the city center although he has no other income to expand his business like he hopes to. For this reason he needs a loan to sell perfumes, conditioners and hair gel, among other personal hygiene products to offer complete service to his customers. This young entrepreneur’s vision is established. In the future he plans to buy a refrigerator to be able to sell drinks at his business and in that way offer greater comfort to his customers.

loans.use: to sell perfumes, conditioners and hair gel, among other personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his stationery business, which sells stationery equipment. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationery items, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and expand the business. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stationery items.

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eva Mercedes, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales 1 está a su cargo,  se dedica al comercio desde hace 13 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de bisuterías en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las 04:00 am  y finalizándolas a las 06:00 pm con el mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar y su hijo.   

Doña Eva, solicito a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo para incrementar su inventario  con productos tales como: cosméticos en general, caramelos, productos diana, chocolates, chicles, entre otros productos, así lograr mayores ventas incrementando su inventario con productos de mayor calidad lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos al igual que un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes is a single mother of four children, one of whom is in her care. She has worked in commerce for the past 13 years, and her current business is selling jewelry in one of the markets in the city of León. She begins to offer her products to her customers at 4:00 am and finishes at 6:00 pm, and maintains the same schedule from Monday through Saturday. She does this job in order to support her household and her son.

Eva requests a loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to increase her inventory with products like cosmetics, candy, Diana brand products, chocolate, gum, etc. This way, she will be able to make more sales and increase her inventory with higher quality goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, candy, Diana brand products, chocolate, gum, etc.

loans.name: Jesús Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Manuel, es padre soltero de 3 hijos pequeños de los cuales 2 están en edad escolar, labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León,  desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos inicia su labores  a las 06:30 am finalizando a las 01:00 pm en  este mismo horario de lunes a domingo, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El señor Jesús,  solicito a  Ceprodel  un crédito el que utilizo para de productos lácteos como es queso duro y borona, lo cual le permitirá incrementar su inventario de trabajo y mejorar su nivel de vida al igual que el de su familia
texts.en:
Jesus Manuel is a single father of three children, two of whom are of school age.  He works as a vendor in one of the markets in the city of Leon.  For five years, he has made a living selling dairy products.  He starts work at 6:30 a.m. and finishes at 1:00 p.m. with the same schedule Monday through Sunday.  He does this work to bring sustenance to his home.
Jesus is asking for a loan from Ceprodel which he will use for dairy products such as hard cheese and breadcrumbs. This will permit him to increase his working inventory and improve his standard of living as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy hard cheese and breadcrumbs.

loans.name: Genaro Antonio

texts.es:
Genaro de 38 años de edad, es empleado, estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato en contaduría, esta soltero, vive con su padre, una hermana y 3 sobrinos de los cuales solo su padre depende de él. 

Genaro se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas tales como: manzanas, naranjas, guineos también a la venta de verduras, tomate, chile, quisquil etc. también se dedica en poner recargas de todas las compañías lo hace desde hace dos años trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien toda su vida se dedico a la venta de frutas y verduras y por la necesidad económica que tenia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para surtir mas el negocio de frutas y verduras, comprando fresas, mangos y fruta de temporada, con lo que podrá satisfacer mas a los clientes y así podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para poder pagar el crédito obtenido en CREDICAMPO y para tener él y su padre una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Genaro es tener un negocio más grande en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Genaro is 38 years old, is employed, and completed three years of a bachelor in accounting degree. He is single, lives with father, a sister, and 3 nephews. Only his father depends on him. 

Genaro makes a living selling fruits such as apples, oranges, and bananas. He also sells vegetables, tomatoes, chili peppers, squash etc. He also makes a living refilling all the companies. He has done this job for the past two years and learned it from his father who sold fruits and vegetables his entire life because of his financial need. 

The loan that he is requesting is to supply his business with more fruits and vegetables, buying strawberries, mangos, and seasonal fruit to satisfy more customers and thus obtain a little more income to pay the loan he obtained from CrediCampo. Also so that he and his father can have a better quality of life. Genaro's dream is have a bigger business in his home.

loans.use: to supply his business with more fruit and vegetables, buying strawberries, mangos, and seasonal fruit

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with four of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Robert has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which sells layers. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more birds, and will help Robert to generate greater profits. Robert hopes that in the future, he will be able to earn more income. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more birds.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogamiques, les sept membres du groupe Badegna ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies de toutes sortes, bananes plantains, laitues, tubercules et poissons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme arrêtée en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse de friperies de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married in monogamous households, the seven members of the group Badegna average 34 years of age and four children each. The women all live in Kalaban-coura, a district of Bamako, and they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban-coura market. The group members have small-scale businesses involving secondhand clothing of any kind, plantains, lettuces, tubers, and fish. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Fanta (the woman standing third from the right in the photo) is a vendor of all kinds of secondhand clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing wholesale in Médine. Door to door, her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kalaban-coura.

With this loan, Ms. Fanta is planning on an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing of any kind

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 38-year-old man. He and his wife Serah are blessed with four children. To earn a living, Patrick operates cereals business. To supplement his income, he has also run a transportation business for the last eight years. He is able to earn a monthly income of KES 15,000 each month.

Patrick was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor. He is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000. The funds are going to be used to repair his motorcycle that has some mechanical issues.

Patrick plans to use the anticipated profit to pay his children's school fees. He hopes to improve his family's living standards and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle that has mechanical issues

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Cecilia, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos y a los cultivos de papa y plátano en el municipio de Montería. Esta son actividades muy comunes en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes las practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar su producción de cultivos y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agropecuarios.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Se siente agradecido con la vida por todos los favores recibidos
texts.en:
Industrious and hopeful are two words that describe Cecilia perfectly. She is a hardworking woman with a family, so she tries to provide a better quality of life for her husband and children.

Cecilia raises and sells chickens. In addition, she cultivates potatoes and bananas in the town of Montería. These types of businesses are very common in the region and a majority of the residents engage in them.

Cecilia possesses great knowledge about her trade. Therefore, she believes that she needs a bit of a boost in order to increase her crop production and expand her business. Cecilia requests financial assistance so that she can invest in the purchase of farming supplies. With this loan, she will be able to continue her business since it is the source of income for her family.

She appreciates all the favors that she has received in life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock in order to start a vegetable store which is for selling and distributing vegetables.

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Salomón de 39 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltero y solo su madre y un tío dependen de él.


Salomón es sastre desde hace 12 años, lo aprendió de un tío que también se dedicaba a lo mismo, Salomón decidió hacer esto ya que no encontraba trabajo cuando terminó de estudiar, además él tiene una pequeña granja de pollo ya que es una persona luchadora que le ha ayudado a su madre a salir adelante, su madre lo apoya en sus actividades para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar 100 pollos y más concentrado para alimentarlos, espera tener buenos resultados para salir a venderlos al mercado.

Sus sueños son tener una granja muy grande de pollos de modo que no le falte el sustento diario en su casa.
texts.en:
Salomón, age 39, studied until high school, is single and his mother and uncle depend on him.

Salomón has been a tailor for the past 12 years. He learned this activity from his uncle who used to work as a tailor too. Salomón decided to follow this path since he couldn’t find any other job when he finished his studies. 

In addition to his work as a tailor, he has a small chicken farm. Because he is a hard working person, he has supported his mother. She helps him in his activities so they can cover the household expenses.

He needs the loan to buy 100 chickens and chicken feed. He hopes to have good results so he can sell them in the market.

His dream is to have a big chicken farm, and in this way have enough incomes for the daily sustenance of his house.

loans.use: to but 100 chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is 27 years old and lives in the town of Ojwina in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Denis has been working hard to manage his clothing business which sells bales of clothes. 

To help expand his business, Denis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Denis to generate greater profits and expand the business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to prosper. 

Denis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Denis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, rice, posho, sodas, salt, mineral water, soap, beer, cooking oil, toilet paper, millet flour, etc. to sell

Scholar was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 100,000 and intends to use this amount to buy hair accessories, hair oils, hair braids, body lotions and hair chemicals to add to her stock which is running low.

Scholar plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child and hopes to become a distributor of cosmetics providing both retail and wholesale services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair accessories, hair oils, hair braids, body lotions and hair chemicals.

Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

In the photo, Beatrice stands at her drum from where she collects the local beers made out of sorghum that are ready for sale.

loans.name: Ashalata

texts.en:

Despite her considerable efforts, she faces difficulties due to the high price of supplies and other expenses of maintaining the farm.

Ashalata is a member of “Dipabali” Self-Help Group managed by the local NGO ‘Sabuj Sangh’ where she was trained in livelihood activities, which  helped her to avoid the damages caused by insects. She also received help in pricing her products and supplies.

Ashalata will use the loan to buy chickens along with their medicines, food and a hatching house. She hopes this will expand her business. Ashalata wants to save enough money for her children’s education. She wants to be an independent and successful woman.

loans.use: to buy chickens, along with their medicines, food and a hatching house
