loans.name: Evaristo Joaquin

texts.es: Evaristo de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, adicional a eso tambien tiene un taller de costura, hace un par de meses solicito un credito para mejorar su vivienda, ahora Don Evaristo esta solicitando otro crédito para comprar: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Evaristo is 65 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has grown corn for the last few years. He sells his product around the area he lives in. besides this he also has a tailor shop. A few months ago he requested a loan to make improvements on his house. Now Evaristo is asking for another loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides etc. to continue with his crops and provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide. etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 54 years old, a widow, and a mother of three. She uses her skills in the manicure and pedicure services as additional source of income. Though she only generates minimal income from the business, she still offers friendly services to all her customers. Beatriz is now asking for a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy nail brushes, cuticle removers, and sets of nail polish to use in the business. She will also buy vegetables to sell for additional income. She hopes to maintain good income as well as extending good services to her customers. (The photo is taken at her house with her grandson beside her.)

loans.use: to buy nail brushes, cuticle removers, and sets of nail polish.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine makes a living by selling grocery goods in her community.She has been in this business for many years and earns better income from this.  Her husband earns money with their transportation service based business as a driver. The couple worked together in order to augment their living.

Josephine took a new loan from GDMPC Micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life she wants to provide for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and groundnut for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 43 years old, married and has five children who are in school. For the past ten years she has earned an income farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines.

Mary Ann has taken out and successfully repaid loans four loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 28 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of items such as bread, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks to sell.

Angie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Angie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as bread, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Neni

texts.en:
Neni is a housewife who lives with her husband and her four children in the family home. The eldest child is a 9-year-old boy, the middle child is an 8-year-old girl, and the youngest are 5-month-old twin baby girls (one of whom is also shown in the picture with her). 

Neni and her husband realize that they have to find ways to support their family's needs, including education funds for their children. For now, Neni's husband works in a private company while Neni is managing a small stall called a "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, consumer goods and mobile airtime credits. She started selling mobile airtime credits and serving bill payments since she began working with Ruma. 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help her in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting her plan to seek more business opportunity in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credits sales on weekends.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa is a 26-year-old married woman with 1 child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Alofa needs a loan to buy a Gas bottle, eggs, bowls, bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large electric stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Alofa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a Gas bottle, eggs, bowls, bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large electric stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and stone, in addition to paying for labor to refurbish his house.

loans.name: Chilo

texts.es: Chilo vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos Chilo vive en la comunidad de Tahari  en una casa de adobe  y se gana la vida comio productor lechero, ademas Chilo es ingeniero agronomo recien graduado Chilo solicita un prestamo para comprar una vaca, de esa manera incrementara su ganado Chilo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Chilo lives in a common-law relationship and has two children. Chilo lives in the community of Tahari in an abobe house. He makes his living as a milk producer. He also is a recently graduated agricultural engineer. Chilo is requesting a loan to buy a cow and in this way increase his herd. Chilo is the only bread-winner in his house and needs your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Iuni

texts.en: Iuni is a 31-year-old woman who is unwed with no children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has 3 years with this business. Iuni needs a loan to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, new paint job and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Iuni joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, new paint job and petrol

loans.name: Nuuao

texts.en: Nuuao is 27 years old and unwed with three children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Nuuao needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps

loans.name: Tinoai

texts.en:
Tinoai is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small plantation business, selling to the members of her community and also to the public at the Market. She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

With this loan, Tinoai is looking at purchasing a mist blower, chemicals, knives, spades, and blade sharpeners for the improvement of her plantation business. Tinoai hopes to save a lot of her profits so that she can improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, knives, spades, and blade sharpeners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs for slaughtering.

loans.name: Maria Ela

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Maria es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, etc.  para seguir con su trabajo y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She works making and selling clothing. Her business is located in her place of residence. Maria is an incredible and exemplar woman who is very hard-working, responsible, and positive, besides many people give testament to her person and her work. She makes a variety of clothing at very accessible prices. She also offers quality in her work so a lot of people prefer her. She has been in this business for many years so she has lots of experience and moreover has loyal clients who prefer her more all the time.

Maria has made the decision to request a loan from Integral to invest in her small business buying fabric, thread, elastic, etc. Then she can continue her work and watch her sales and revenues increase. She hopes to achieve her objective and improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two quintals of fertilizer and one liter of poison.

loans.name: Marcelino De Jesus

texts.es: Marcelino de 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. Marcelino tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Marcelino, 50, lives in his own home with his family.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn.  He has many years of experience in this line of work, and his experience is valuable because it enables him to obtain better harvests.  The land that he cultivates is located in an agricultural area. He sells his crops in the surrounding areas, and he already has a lot of regular customers who prefer his products because of the quality and affordable prices.  In addition, he provides excellent service.  Marcelino wants to invest in agricultural supplies, but he needs capital.  This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, insecticides, pest control, tools, etc.  Marcelino has good credit references, and he is sure that he will be able to pay off his loan on time.  He also has confidence that the loan will enable him to give his family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sergio Giovani

texts.es: Sergio de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de venta de golosinas y licuados cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela pues lo que comercializa es muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Sergio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: frutas por mayor, leche, azúcar, golosinas, refresos, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Sergio is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his family.  For several years he has a business selling candy and drinks near his home.  He has many customers, since what he sells is always in demand.  With his earnings he is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as fruit at wholesale, as well as milk, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other items.  This will enable him to continue with his business, which generates good income and thus brings greater financial stability to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit at wholesale, as well as milk, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Sara Josefina

texts.es: Sara de 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo y tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijas, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Sara solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en: Sara is 47 years old and has sold tortillas from her home for several years. She works from Monday to Sunday and has many customers. She is a very hardworking and friendly person. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. With the earning from her sales and the support of her husband, they manage to cover the costs of the household. Sara requests a loan to buy bulk corn to continue to make tortillas to obtain better profits for better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es: Sonia de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, el esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logar solventar los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, arroz, golosinas, refrescos, jabon, detergente, frijoles, etc. para surtir su tienda y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two children.  Her husband works in a private business, and she has a store in their home.  She has had the store for many years, and she has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells.  With her earnings, and the help of her husband, she is able to cover their household expenses.  

Sonia is seeking a loan to purchase soups, rice, snacks, drinks, soap, detergent, beans, etc. to stock her store and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase soups, rice, snacks, drinks, soap, detergent, beans, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 51 años de edad tiene un foto estudio digital ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de su trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Manuel esta solicitando un credito para la compra de material fotografía como: rollos, papel especial, tinta especial, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 51 years old and has a digital photo studio located in a very well-trafficked area close to his home.  He has many customers given the quality of his work, and with his earnings, he is able to get ahead with the household expenses.  He lives in a home that he owns with his family.

Manuel is seeking a loan to purchase photography supplies such as: film, special paper, special ink, etc. so that he can continue working since it is his only source of income.  This will allow him and his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase film, special paper, special ink, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia se dedica a trabajar en su molino desde hace varios, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y su molino ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica a su familia sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: Herminia has been working with her mill for the past number of years, processing all types of foods like corn, beans, flours. sauces amongst others. She is well-known by the people in her community and has grown a large clientele. She lives in her own house with her family. In the past weeks the demand for the use of her mill has increased and she cannot meet the demand. So she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to allow her to buy a new mill for her work. She has good credit references and is responsible. She promises to pay off her debt and at the same time she has the faith that she can provide her family with economic security without limits.

loans.use: to buy a new mill for her work.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Eliewaja, who is in her mid 40’s, is a widow with three children, two of them go to school and the other one is a grown-up.  She has been running a retail shop and M-pesa for seven years now.  She works from 6.30 a.m. until 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Eliewaja's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling M-pesa and restocked the out of stock items in her retail shop. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She will use this loan to replenish the shop stock with fast moving items.  She dreams of opening another retail shop in a different place.

Eliewaja will share this loan with her loan group Karoti, which has a total of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her shop with fast moving items.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa de 64 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar. Ella  tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa usada ó de segunda, cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. El puesto de Rosa es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan y la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa usada y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has a business selling used or secondhand clothing. It is in a very busy area and well known by people who live there. Here she offers a variety of articles of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. 

Rosa's stand is much visited, as people always find what they are looking for, and friendliness and good service are the most important things. 


Her dream is to see her business grow, so she has decided to take out a loan from Integral so that she can buy more bundles of used clothing and have a greater variety of clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, T-shirts, shorts, and other items. Her aim is to attract more buyers and achieve a higher level of sales as well as a greater level of income so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, blouses, T-shirts, shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to register her degree

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en: Sahira is a 57-year-old, Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children; some of them are still attending school. She works in cooperation with her husband who works as an accountant to meet the family’s needs. She works in the agricultural field and has spent many years doing a great effort to earn a sufficient income. And with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., Sahira wishes to purchase products needed such as seeds and fertilizers to help grow her crops and augment her productivity. Her aim is to amplify her income, to enhance the family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase products needed such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gabriela Alejandra

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer joven de 18 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y se dedica al tejido de buzos de lana a máquina.
Ella es alegre, simpática, feliz, trabajadora, emprendedora, decidida, a pesar de su corta edad ya tiene muchas metas y objetivos en la vida. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona 16 de julio, cada jueves y domingo en la feria del mismo nombre.
Gabriela es de tez morena, cabello lacio negro largo, ojos marrones, estatura mediana, su labor la aprendió de su mamá, que; viendo las pocas oportunidades laborales y el difícil acceso a un estudio superior, optó por enseñarle y transmitirle sus conocimientos en el arte del tejido. Gabriela terminó sus estudios secundarios y se dedicó por completo al trabajo y al tejido, obteniendo ganancias económicas para ayudar a su familia. Su rutina es de lunes a domingo, todos los días se dedica a tejer excepto los jueves y domingos, días en los que arma su puesto de venta para ofrecer sus creaciones en la feria 16 de julio.
Su taller es un cuarto que lo utiliza como dormitorio, ella necesita reunir dinero para refaccionar las paredes (obra fina) y mejorar su ambiente laboral y por ende su calidad de vida. Su sueño es incrementar su producción y tener un taller de tejido y de costura para diversificar su producción.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su cuarto para mejorar su taller para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is an 18 year old woman.  She is single and works weaving wool suits.  She is a very cheerful, friendly, happy, hardworking, enterprising, and dedicated person.  Despite her young age, she has many goals and objectives in life.  She runs her business in the "16 de julio" region, every thursday and sunday in the local market.  Gabriela has a dark complexion, long, straight, black hair, brown eyes, and she is of medium height.  She learned her trade from her mother who after seeing the few work opportunities and the difficulty accessing higher education, decided to teach her the art of weaving.  

After finishing high school, Gabriela devoted herself completely to working and weaving.  Through this, she is able to earn an income to help her family.  She works from Monday to Sunday, and everyday, she weaves, except for Thursdays and Sundays when she runs her stand in the "16 de julio" market.  

Her workshop is a room that she also uses as a bedroom.  She needs to collect money to refurbish the walls  and improve the work environment, and in so doing, improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to increase her productivity and have a workshop for weaving and sewing in order to diversity her production.  For these reasons, Gabriela is seeking a loan to renovate her room so that she can improve her workshop and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate her room to improve her weaving workshop so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Beatriz ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.
La socia que esta tapada su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Kantu de San Jeronimo. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “KANTU SAN JERONIMO” communal bank which is located in the District of Cusco which belongs to the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.

Beatriz is one of the members. She is married, 47 years old and has two children. She works as a Primary school teacher. She works from 8 am until 2 pm and has been working for eight years in this business and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have a business selling clothing. Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy a TV set for her house.

The person with their face blanked out does not belong the “KANTU SAN JERONIMO” communal bank. The other members work in a internet business, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a restaurant. The member thanks those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan as established.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 46-year-old single woman. She works very hard in producing homemade food with the aim of satisfying her living needs. She started this business a couple of years ago and she is very talented at it and prepares delicious provisions.  Today, Zeinab wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase required necessities, as she intends to increase her productivity, and hence her income. Zeinab looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans, as now she works from her home and wishes to open her own store as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase required necessities for her business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 27-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. Four years ago, she started to work from her home as a private teacher where she has arranged a special room to teach students appropriately. She works in cooperation with her husband, a plumber, with the intention of gaining an enough income to live properly. At present, she is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a laptop, as she wants to organize and systematize all documents, and exercises, and to make her preparations easier to perform.  Zeinab states that the loan will help her to enhance her work, and plans to request additional Kiva loans for more improvements.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Hợp

texts.en:
Hợp works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Hợp is 62 years old and is married with four children.  She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hợp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Hợp faces in her life is not having a clean water system.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build a clean water system.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a clean water system

loans.name: Maylanie

texts.en: Maylanie, 37 years old, is from Paniqui, Tarlac. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband, a tricycle driver, is the family's source of income. Maylanie's family is financially challenged, and so she wants to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to help send her son to college. Mark Joseph is taking an automotive servicing course to easily find a job and to help his family. Mark Joseph is hoping that lenders will approve his mother’s loan request.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is 25 years old, married and has three children. Due to hardship of living, she and her husband work together to sustain the necessities of their family. She operates their motorcycle transport while her husband works in their farm. To continuously use the motorcycle, she wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this loan, Noemi believes that she will continuously operate their motorcycle and increase her income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, gasoline, and spare parts.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Longanisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices) is one of the Filipino favorite breakfasts.  Rebecca makes delicious longanisa and sells it to her friends and neighbors. She is a 52-year-old widow with 3 children. Because of her business, she could send her children to college to finish their courses. However, with the demand of her customers, she highly needs additional capital to buy ingredients for her chosen business. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost four years in service. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for longanisa.

loans.name: Rosmil

texts.en:
Rosmil is 36 years old and lives in Centro Hulpa, Tudela, Philippines. She is married without children. She has a piggery business and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 
Rosmil is having a project of repairing their house. She wants to improve their living condition.She has requested a loan to purchase housing materials.

Rosmil has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, she hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 43-year-old married man with three children. He lives with his family in Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. 

Joel earns a living as a barber and he also raises hogs. Last year, a typhoon hit the country leaving thousands of Filipinos homeless and with their business completely damaged. Joel asked for 15,000 PHP to buy a business permit and pay the shop's rent. He will also buy feed for the piglets. 

Joel hopes that this loan could help him start his business again to generate income to meet the needs of the family, especially to educated his children. In the future, Joel dreams of expanding his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to pay for the business permit and rental of his shop.

loans.name: Felda

texts.en:
Felda joined Paglaum MPC in the year 2006 and she appreciates the programs,services and continuous education of the co-op. Felda is a businesswoman while her husband is a security guard. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and service that the co-op offers. 

Felda wants to support the renewal of security guard license of her husband which is due to expire. She is requesting a loan to pay for the renewal of security guard license of her husband. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum MPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of security guard license

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 34 years old and lives in Dao, Pagadian City. She is married with one child.

Richel has a bag making business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business.

Richel has been a member for two years. In the future, she hopes for an expansion.

loans.use: to buy materials for bag making

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2013. She appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

Marilayn is a businesswoman that sells variety of items. She makes good sales of school and office supplies and personal hygiene products. Now she she wants to venture in selling RTWs. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 intended to pay RTW products.

Marialyn dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to pay for RTW  clothing products

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 34 years old.  She is married and has two children and lives in Ozamiz City, Philippines. To earn a living, she has a retail business to support the needs of her family.  There is a need to repair their home, which is indeed important. Because of this, she asks help to Paglaum MPC to answer her needs. She loan the amount of Php 15,000.00 to buy roofing materials.

Lerma, then, is thankful to the cooperative for the financial assistance given.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

She has an auto spare parts store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 20,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for 30,000 for additional capital to purchase inventories of auto and spare parts to sell.

Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of auto and spare parts to sell

loans.name: Alber

texts.en:
Alber has been providing transportation services in their community for more than six years. He earns well from this aside from farming, the main source of income. His children were successful in their studies and he had to sustain their living. 

Alber successfully repaid his previous loan used for the vehicle repair out from his  income. 

To ensure better services he could provide to his costumers, he took a new loan to buy a new set of tires to replace the old used tires. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and wants to save his profit to use it when they get old.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires to replace the old used tires

loans.name: Ma. Jeremy

texts.en:
Ma. Jeremy is 20 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is single and has high hopes for her family. 

Ma. Jeremy signed up for membership and is requesting a loan to pay tuition fees. In the future, she hopes to finish her studies to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 30 years old, married to Joseph, and blessed with five children aged between 12 and 1 1/2 years old. She has been selling variety of clothes for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more clothes for sale. Dorothy repaid her previous loan successfully.                                                                                          

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open a bigger studio.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 34 years old and married. She lives in Plaridel, Mis. Occ. Charlita has a business selling liniments and vapor rubs. She joined PMPC to access its programs and services especially the needed capital of her business.

Charlita is requesting a loan to increase her working capital to purchase inventories of liniments and vapor rubs to sell. She hopes to double her income as she prepares for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of liniments andvapor rubs to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena. Her previous loan was a big help for her buying and selling business as she was able to purchase additional merchandise like charcoal and personal products. The loan was also useful for the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional stocks of charcoal needed in her business and also products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her direct-selling. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena dreams of prospering in her businesses. She also hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies through all their hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

*Rowena is shown in the photo with her charcoal business.

loans.use: to pay for charcoal and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is years old 38 and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosanna has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mela

texts.en:
Maepril who is a daughter of Mela (a member of NWTF) is 18 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. She is currently on the first year of this four-year course.

Maepril needs 7,000 Philippines pesos to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Maepril plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees
